citation.article-title: Spirosoma panaciterrae sp. nov., isolated from soil.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Spirosoma panaciterrae sp. nov.
Spirosoma panaciterrae (pa.na.ci.ter′rae. N.L. n. Panax -acis scientific name for ginseng; L. n. terra soil; N.L. gen. n. panaciterrae of soil from a ginseng field, the source of the type strain).
Cells are Gram-negative, rod-shaped and do not form endospores.
Non-diffusible yellow pigments are produced.
Grows at 15–42 °C and pH 5.0–9.0; optimum growth occurs at 30 °C and pH 6.5–7.0.
Does not require NaCl for growth, but can tolerate 1 % (w/v) NaCl.
Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite.
Growth occurs on nutrient agar and TSA.
Able to hydrolyse gelatin and starch (weakly), but not chitin, xylan, carboxymethylcellulose, casein or DNA.

Produces N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, α-galactosidase, acid phosphatase and naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase.

Does not produce lipase (C14), valine arylamidase, arginine dihydrolase, lysine decarboxylase, ornithine decarboxylase, tryptophan deaminase, urease, cystine arylamidase, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-mannosidase or α-fucosidase.
The following substrates are utilized for growth: l-arabinose, d-glucose, d-mannose, cellobiose, maltose, melibiose, sucrose, N-acetylglucosamine and salicin.

The following substrates are not utilized for growth: d-fructose, d-galactose, d-xylose, l-rhamnose, d-ribose, l-fucose, l-sorbose, raffinose, d-sorbitol, inositol, d-mannitol, dulcitol, glycerol, glycogen, acetate, citrate, gluconate, 3- or 4-hydroxybenzoate, malonate, itaconate, 2- or 5-ketogluconate, dl-3-hydroxybutyrate, valerate, malate, propionate, caprate, phenylacetate, adipate, lactate, suberate, l-alanine, l-histidine, l-proline or l-serine.
The Voges–Proskauer reaction and tests for the production of H2S and indole are negative.
Acid is produced from d-mannose (weakly), d-sorbitol, aesculin ferric citrate, salicin (weakly), cellobiose, maltose and trehalose.

Acid is not produced from glycerol, erythritol, d- or l-arabinose, d-ribose, d- or l-xylose, d-adonitol, methyl β-d-xylose, d-glucose, d-fructose, l-sorbose, l-rhamnose, dulcitol, inositol, d-mannitol, methyl α-d-mannopyranoside, methyl α-d-glucopyranoside, amygdalin, arbutin, d-lactose, melibiose, sucrose, inulin, melezitose, starch, glycogen, xylitol, gentiobiose, turanose, d-lyxose, d-tagatose, d- and l-fucose, d- or l-arabitol, gluconate, or 2- or 5-ketogluconate.
The major fatty acids are C16 : 1ω5c, summed feature 4 (C16 : 1ω7c and/or iso-C15 : 0 2-OH) and iso-C15 : 0.
The predominant menaquinone is MK-7.
Phosphatidylethanolamine is the major polar lipid.
The type strain, Gsoil 1519T (=KCTC 22263T=DSM 21099T), was isolated from soil of a ginseng field in Pocheon province (South Korea).
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 50.1 mol%.
